intro: Spiraea alba proles latifolia, commonly known as the white spiraea or broadleaf spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features dense, arching clusters of white flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from April to May. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually 2–5 inches long and have a smooth, glossy texture. It thrives in partial to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soils. This species is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
